data.title: 🎬 Mani Ratnam, one of India’s greatest filmmakers, turns 68 today. Ratnam has directed nearly 30 films and produced over 15 across Tamil,...
data.meta_description:
3,197 likes, 22 comments - _thejuggernaut on June 2, 2024: "🎬 Mani Ratnam, one of India’s greatest filmmakers, turns 68 today. 

Ratnam has directed nearly 30 films and produced over 15 across Tamil, Hindi, Malayalam, Telugu, and Kannada. He has won six National Film Awards, four Filmfares, and six Filmfare South awards. In 2002, the Indian government awarded him the Padma Shri, the fourth-highest civilian awards. 

Ratnam was born to a film family in #Madras but originally didn’t want to go into the industry, getting an MBA instead and becoming a consultant. Bored with his job and after reconnecting with an old friend, he reconsidered and has delivered some of the biggest commercial and critical hits. 

Ratnam is best known for his terrorism trilogy: #Roja (1992), #Bombay (1995), and #DilSe.. (1998) as well as his love trilogy, #MounaRagam (1986), #AlaiPayuthey (2000, and #OKhadhaiKanmani (2005). 

#DilSe was his Hindi film debut and starred #ShahRukhKhan (@iamsrk), #ManishaKoirala, and #PreityZinta in her debut. The film saw average success in India, but became a huge hit among diaspora audiences, who appreciated the love story and the legendary @arrahman soundtrack, which included #ChaiyyaChaiyya, #JiyaJale, and #DilSeRe. 

As soon as long-time collaborator @arrahman showed him “Chaiyya Chaiyya,” Ratnam knew he wanted to shoot it on a train. #SRK called it a scary experience because there was no CGI or special effects — all the dancers indeed performed on a slow moving train. 

Ratnam’s most recent releases include Tamil epic dramas #PonniyinSelvanI (2022) and its sequel, #PonniyinSelvanII (2023). 

What’s your favorite #ManiRatnam film? 👇🏾👇🏾👇🏾

Read more about Ratnam’s work at the link in bio, then click this image 🔗".
